items.title: Experience & Qualifications
items.summary: I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist with the BBS, for the state of California. (LIC# LMFT106683) Education: Masters of Science in…
items.content_html:
I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist with the BBS, for the state of California. (LIC# LMFT106683)
 
Education:
  • Masters of Science in Clinical Psychology from Vanguard University of Southern California
  • Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Vanguard University of Southern California
 
Experience with:
  • Adults 18 - 70
  • Adolescents
  • Children as young as 5 years old.
  • Parents
  • Families 
  • Community Mental Health
  • Partial Hospitalization Programs (PHP)
  • Intensive Outpatient Programs (IOP)
  • Non-Public School Setting
  • Public School Setting
  • IEP Experience
  • WRAP Around
  • Group Homes for Adolescents
 
Organizations worked for or in collaboration with:
  • College Hospitals
  • Olive Crest
  • CA Mentor/Sevita
  • South Coast Children's Society
  • Department of Mental Health (DMH)
  • Department of Child and Family Services (DCFS)

items.title: Refuge Counseling Co
items.summary: I am a therapist who loves helping people grow and work through difficult emotions and experiences. My passion is working with adults, adolescents,…
items.content_html:
I am a therapist who loves helping people grow and work through difficult emotions and experiences. My passion is working with adults, adolescents, and parents on improving relationships, working through life-transitions, family problems (past and present), and other emotional struggles encountered. Anxiety and depression can feel debilitating, but it doesn't have to be. I have seen the deep emotional struggle many young people face, that can also impact adulthood. I have also had the opportunity to work with parents on improving their relationship with their teens and children, while setting consistent boundaries to support them.
 
Therapy should be a space for healing and to process, free from judgements, so my aim is to create a space for my clients where they know they can be their true self. My therapeutic approach is grounded in evidence-based treatment, and adapted to the unique struggles you are facing.
 
Through my own personal journey in psychotherapy, I have been able to feel first-hand the impact and healing that can occur with the right therapist. My desire is to meet others where they are, and offer a safe, inviting space where clients are able to explore, grow and heal. I know how difficult it is to take this first step, but know you are not alone!

items.title: Therapeutic Approach
items.summary: The base of my therapy is most often utilizing the evidenced-based treatment of Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT). In your first session, we will…
items.content_html:
The base of my therapy is most often utilizing the evidenced-based treatment of Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT). In your first session, we will look at symptoms, behaviors, and goals to determine the best approach for your treatment. With DBT specifically, we look at: increasing effective coping skills, improving emotional regulation, building distress tolerance, and practicing effective communication, all while incorporating mindfulness. Other therapeutic modalities I often incorporate into my approach are as follows:
 
Cognitive Behavioral (CBT)
Culturally Sensitive
Family Systems
Person-Centered
Psychodynamic
Trauma Focused
Attachment

items.content_html:
Services

  • Individual therapy - with adults and youth 12 years and older. Family therapy sessions may be recommended or offered as-needed.
  • Therapy for grad psych students in need of personal therapy hours.

  • Clinical Supervision - Individual or Group Supervision can be provided on a contracted basis.

  • Educational Presentations or Workshops.

items.title: Rates & Fees
items.summary: $200 is my top fee per session. I offer an income-based sliding scale for those who qualify. I also work with lien agreement…
items.content_html:
• $200 is my top fee per session. I offer an income-based sliding scale for those who qualify. I also work with lien agreement clients for an increased fee.
  • $100 per session for clients in a Graduate Psychology or Social Work program.

  • For clinical supervision, workshops, or educational presentations, my fees are negotiable.

items.content_html:
Please email us at info@refugecounselingco.com

A member of our team will contact you to schedule a free phone consultation and go over our services.  All sessions are currently online.

items.title: FAQ
items.summary: This depends on your presenting problems, but, usually, no less than 8 sessions. Some clients may require or choose long-term therapy for ongoing…
items.content_html:
How long is therapy?

This depends on your presenting problems, but, usually, no less than 8 sessions. Some clients may require or choose long-term therapy for ongoing problems, and other clients are able to address targeted issues within 8-10 sessions. It all depends on your needs, and this will be discussed and revisited throughout treatment.

 

What can I expect? 

A safe, non-judgmental environment to discuss what your problems are, how they are affecting you, and what changes you would like to make. Therapy is NOT advice. It is a space where we will identify patterns, help connect dots, process difficult emotions and experiences, and identify tools that may be more helpful than current ways of coping. 
 

Are you faith-based?

I am a Christian, and incorporate faith and spirituality into therapy when my clients request to approach therapy from that worldview. The modalities I use for therapy do not require a Christian or faith-based approach, and I always consider and respect the spiritual beliefs of my clients. I have worked with clients from many backgrounds, and only bring faith/spiritual beliefs into the therapeutic space when the client invites it.
 

How do I get started?

I offer a free 15-minute consultation, so you can simply call, text, or email to schedule a no-obligation phone call to see if I'm the right fit for you.
 

How do I know who the right therapist is for me?

Ask yourself the following: Does the therapist list the issues you are struggling with? Does the therapist feel like someone you could be open with in time? Are you okay with their gender, approach to therapy, and mode of therapy (in-person or virtual)?
 

Do you take insurance?

No, I do not. I do work with lien agreements and offer an income-based sliding scale. 
 

How much does this cost?

My fee per session is $200, unless a lower fee is agreed upon, based on your income. If you are a grad psych student, I charge $100 per session. 
 

Do you have availability?

Yes! I currently have availability during the week-days.
